algorithm_technique: Divide and conquer approach to merge skylines recursively.
Sweep line algorithm with a max-heap to track active building heights.
problem_summary_simple: Generate the skyline contour from a list of buildings.
problem_summary_technical: Divide and conquer to recursively compute skylines for halves and merge them, maintaining key points and heights.
key_insights: The problem can be solved efficiently using a divide and conquer strategy similar to merge sort.
The key challenge is the `MergeSkylines` function, which needs to correctly combine two skylines, handling overlapping intervals and height changes.
The merge logic must consider the start and end points of buildings and the current maximum height from both skylines.
A sweep-line approach processes events (building start/end points) in order.
A max-heap is used to keep track of the heights of buildings currently active at the sweep line's position.
When the maximum height in the heap changes, a new key point in the skyline is generated.
